alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Essex; King William; King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 09 at 3:25PM EDT until September 09 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern King and Queen County in east central Virginia... East central Caroline County in north central Virginia... West central Westmoreland County in east central Virginia... Northwestern King William County in east central Virginia... Northwestern Essex County in east central Virginia... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 325 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Saint Stephens Church, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Newtown around 330 PM EDT. Loretto around 355 PM EDT. Leedstown around 410 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Beazley, Enfield, Sparta, Central Garage, Owenton, Hustle, Elevon, Supply, Peeds, and Upshaw. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Essex; King William; King and Queen; Westmoreland
